bit_field.name: USB_SPEED
bit_field.description: Defines which USB module is used for ISP:

bit_field_value.name: USB_FS
bit_field_value.description: USB FS module used for ISP

bit_field_value.name: USB_HS
bit_field_value.description: USB HS module used for ISP

bit_field.name: BOOT_FAILURE_PIN
bit_field.description: GPIO port and pin number to use for indicating failure reason. The toggle rate of the pin is used to decode the error type. [2:0] - Defines GPIO port [7:3] - Defines GPIO pin

bit_field.name: SPI_RECOVERY_BOOT_EN
bit_field.description: SPI flash recovery boot is enabled, if non-zero value is written to this field.

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_PIN
register.description:
Device Configuration Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Pinned. 
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level: 
- PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product. 
- PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate. 
- PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected. 
- PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and can't be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bit_field.name: CPU1_DBGEN
bit_field.description: CPU1 (Micro cortex M33) invasive debug enable

bit_field.name: CPU1_NIDEN
bit_field.description: CPU1 (Micro cortex M33) non-invasive debug enable

bit_field.name: UUID_CHECK
bit_field.description: Enforce UUID match during Debug authentication.

register.name: DCFG_CC_SOCU_DFLT
register.description:
Device Configuration Credential Constraints for SoC specific Use Debug Filter. 
Combinations of PIN and DFLT bits and resulting restriction level: 
- PIN=1,DFLT=1: Restriction level 0. Access to the sub-domain is always enabled. This setting is provided for module use case scenario where DCFG_CC_SOCU_NS would be used to define further access restrictions before final deployment of the product. 
- PIN=0,DFLT=0: Restriction level 1. Access to the sub-domain is disabled at startup. But the access can be enabled through debug authentication process by providing appropriate Debug Credential (DC) certificate. 
- PIN=0,DFLT=1: Illegal setting. Part may lock-up if this setting is selected. 
- PIN=1,DFLT=0: Restriction level 3. Access to the sub-domain is permanently disabled and can't be reversed. This setting offers the highest level of restriction.

bit_field.name: NIDEN
bit_field.description: Non Secure non-invasive debug fixed state

bit_field.name: CPU1_DBGEN
bit_field.description: CPU1 (Micro cortex M33) invasive debug fixed state

bit_field.name: FA_ME_CMD_EN
bit_field.description: Fault Analysis/Mass Erase Command fixed state

bit_field.name: CPU1_NIDEN
bit_field.description: CPU1 (Micro cortex M33) non-invasive debug fixed state

bit_field.name: VENDOR_USAGE
bit_field.description: Upper 16 bits of vendor usage field defined in DAP. Lower 16-bits come from customer field area.

bit_field.name: DICE_INC_NXP_CFG
bit_field.description: Include NXP area in DICE computation.

bit_field.name: DICE_CUST_CFG
bit_field.description: Include Customer factory area (including keys) in DICE computation.

bit_field_value.name: HEADER
bit_field_value.description: TZ-M image mode is taken from application image header

bit_field_value.name: DISABLED
bit_field_value.description: TZ-M disabled image, boots to non-secure mode

bit_field_value.name: ENABLED
bit_field_value.description: TZ-M enabled image, boots to secure mode

bit_field_value.name: PRESET
bit_field_value.description: TZ-M enabled image with TZ-M preset, boot to secure mode TZ-M pre-configured by data from application image header

bit_field_value.name: DISABLE
bit_field_value.description: Plain image (internal flash with or without CRC)

bit_field_value.name: ENABLE_0
bit_field_value.description: Boot signed images. (internal flash, RSA signed)

bit_field_value.name: ENABLE_1
bit_field_value.description: Boot signed images. (internal flash, RSA signed)

bit_field_value.name: ENABLE_2
bit_field_value.description: Boot signed images. (internal flash, RSA signed)

bit_field.name: ADDR0_PRG
bit_field.description: Programmable portion of the base address of region 0

bit_field.name: ADDR1_PRG
bit_field.description: Programmable portion of the base address of region 1

bit_field.name: ADDR2_PRG
bit_field.description: Programmable portion of the base address of region 2

bit_field.name: REG0_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bit_field.description: For PRINCE region0 enable checking whether all encrypted pages are erased together

bit_field.name: REG1_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bit_field.description: For PRINCE region1 enable checking whether all encrypted pages are erased together

bit_field.name: REG2_ERASE_CHECK_EN
bit_field.description: For PRINCE region2 enable checking whether all encrypted pages are erased together

bit_field_value.name: NOT_TRIM
bit_field_value.description: Capa Bank trimmings not valid. Default trimmings value are used

bit_field.name: XTAL_LOAD_CAP_IEC_PF_X100
bit_field.description: Load capacitance, pF x 100. For example, 6pF becomes 600.

bit_field.name: PCB_XIN_PARA_CAP_PF_X100
bit_field.description: PCB XIN parasitic capacitance, pF x 100. For example, 6pF becomes 600.

bit_field.name: PCB_XOUT_PARA_CAP_PF_X100
bit_field.description: PCB XOUT parasitic capacitance, pF x 100. For example, 6pF becomes 600.

bit_field_value.name: NOT_TRIM
bit_field_value.description: Capa Bank trimmings not valid. Default trimmings value are used

bit_field.name: XTAL_LOAD_CAP_IEC_PF_X100
bit_field.description: Load capacitance, pF x 100. For example, 6pF becomes 600.

bit_field.name: PCB_XIN_PARA_CAP_PF_X100
bit_field.description: PCB XIN parasitic capacitance, pF x 100. For example, 6pF becomes 600.

bit_field.name: PCB_XOUT_PARA_CAP_PF_X100
bit_field.description: PCB XOUT parasitic capacitance, pF x 100. For example, 6pF becomes 600.

register.name: ROTKH0
register.description: ROTKH0 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[255:224]

register.name: ROTKH2

register.description: ROTKH4 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[127:96]

register.name: ROTKH5
register.description: ROTKH5 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[95:64]

register.name: ROTKH6
register.description: ROTKH6 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[63:32]

register.name: ROTKH7
register.description: ROTKH7 for Root of Trust Keys Table hash[31:0]
